Itâ€™s funny that they slander me specifically with their gooner projections because my relationship discourse take has for years been incredibly conservative even by dissident right standards: fornification (sex outside marriage) should be illegal (as it always used to be) & marriage should require consent of both sideâ€™s fathers (as it always used to). These two simple rules will at once undo casual sex and dating culture (as opposed to courtship)â€”which are entirely at the disservice of women, and thus, household order, and the well being of the childrenâ€”returning to the natural universal order of marriage courtship with heavily mutual family involvement to ensure dynastic â€œselective breedingâ€ is maintained. Itâ€™s entirely for the protection of women, which counter to self-sabotaging feminist theory all traditional cultural institutions around marriage were designed solely towards, a universal because they suffer from real biological consequences to promiscuity and a loss of virginity that men simply donâ€™t; thus itâ€™s the fatherâ€™s and brotherâ€™s responsibility to protect the unmarried women in their family, a responsibility the husband inherits, and which ultimately scales to society as a whole. It used to be understood a woman would never be left unattended with a non-family male, these rules were for their safety, not their â€œoppressionâ€.

As my â€œrelationship discourse takeâ€, itâ€™s just what Iâ€™ve ascertained as the ground floor of truth which the discourse is groping for; while a useful reference locally, itâ€™s not a position I advocate for politically, I do agree itâ€™s pointless. why no melatonin?

Melatonin is hormone therapy. It's not a mineral or a vitamin, it's a hormone, and one that specifically interfaces with the reproductive system. Baycels have been promoting melatonin for decades without stopping to consider the downregulation effect of supplementing an exogenous hormone, consumed daily in a dose 10-100X times your body's natural production btw. All for a sleep aid. Not once did they bother to learn, or inform you, that exogenous melatonin supplementation is known to delay puberty in teens and disrupt the menstrual cycle. I need you to seriously stop and about the critical thinking capabilities of anyone who considers themselves a "rationalist" "lifestyle experimentalist" who consumes melatonin as a sleep aid. If you meet one on the road, ask if they ever stopped to wonder melatonin being prescribed as a treatment for erectile dysfunction might have other consequences when supplemented daily 10X the bodies natural production? Then ask if they got the vaxx, and inform them their fish oil has gone rancid, and ask why high iq autism is highly correlated with gender dysphoria. The safe sleep aid supplement is glycine btw and either honey in warm milk or natural ice cream before bed; and simply a regular sleep schedule, and keep your window open at night to minimize CO2 levels.

The consilience approach relies on a concordance of evidence to find reliable truth necessary when individual data points cannot be verified in isolation, but their validity can be made more certain by the number of confirming points. Conspiracy research, hinged on the principle that evidence is being covered up, follows this modeâ€”â€œprovingâ€ a fire by identifying many points of smoke until it appears more likely to be true than not true. Note that degrees of â€œlikelyâ€ is best truth we can receive in this mode, never certainty.
